thread.title: Manchester United fail in bid to snap-up rivals City’s chief transfer guru and head scout
thread.title_full: Manchester United fail in bid to snap-up rivals City’s chief transfer guru and head scout

author: ashilton
title: Manchester United fail in bid to snap-up rivals City’s chief transfer guru and head scout
text:
Comments MANCHESTER UNITED are thought to have failed with a double raid on rivals City. 
The Mail report that United have tried to lure both the City’s transfer chief and head of local talent spotting. Reuters Jose Mourinho’s United have failed in a double raid on Man City 
Academy scouts Dave Harrison and Lyndon Tomlinson have recently defected from Blues to the Reds. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Manchester City and Manchester United news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
But City believe that they will keep hold of key staff member Rob Newman, who oversees their network of scouts, as well as Trevor Todd who is responsible for finding local talent. 
Ed Woodward has been on a major recruitment drive at United, having appointed sports headhunters Nolan Partners to take them forward. Century boy Arsenal's Theo Walcott vows to keep banging in the goals after reaching his century against Sutton United Getty Images 5 Woodward is doing everything he can to improve United’s network 
United have since bagged around 50 new scouts and turned to Todd due to City’s continued excellence at youth level. 
Had Newman moved to United then it would have created a scenario similar to that which developed at Everton over the summer, with N’Golo Kante spotter Steve Walsh moving from Leicester and training his sights on former Foxes targets. 
Lucas Perez was one, before eventually moving to Arsenal. News Group Newspapers Ltd 5 Newman (left) during his stint as a Southend defender 
Newman pitched up at the Etihad in 2008 around the time of the club’s takeover by Khaldoon Al Mubarak. 
The 53-year-old spent the first ten years of his career playing for Bristol City before spending seven seasons with Norwich and four with Southend. 
He had short managerial stint in charge of the Shrimpers and Cambridge, and was also Bournemouth assistant for a couple of seasons. Jose Mourinho starts mind games after Manchester United draw Chelsea in the FA Cup quarter-final
